content: PARIS, May 3 (Reuters) - BNP Paribas, the eurozone's biggest bank, won't use the proceeds from the sale of its U.S. retail division to buy another lender, Chief Financial Officer Lars Machenil said on Wednesday.

"When it comes to the Bank of the West redeployment (of capital gains)... we will not buy anything with the word bank in it. We stick to that," Machenil told analysts when pressed to say how BNP would spend the gains.Machenil added that the plan for BNP was to grow organically.Separately, BNP Paribas' CFO said he didn't anticipate banking failures in the eurozone like the ones seen in the United States, citing the extent of the European Central Bank's supervision over banks on the continent. (Reporting by Mathieu Rosemain;Editing by Elaine Hardcastle)
